talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter:
Except Mehdi is not an actual journalist. These channels have blurred the lines with these pundits who are lawyers, political consultants, politicians, broadcasters and “personalities”. 

Where are the journalists? The reporters? Actual members of the press? 

Expertise is taking a backseat.

talk.author: did:plc:yzxtjv67kfgn4qwgbjjxheca
talk.utter: Journalists and reporters are wasting away because American citizenship chose pablum years ago.

talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter: I agree! This election needs to serve as a wake up call for us all to demand more professionalism from our press, by way of more voices and contributions from those who have been trained in journalistic investigations, integrity and ethics. We will never get that from pundits.

talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter: I agree! This election needs to serve as a wake up call for us all to demand more professionalism from our press, by way of more voices and contributions from those who have been trained in journalistic investigations, integrity and ethics. We will never get that from pundits.

talk.author: did:plc:og46rvum7lhi3mfyyy7odtir
talk.utter: I don’t disagree with you on this point, btw. Only that Hasan isn’t a journo. There are far too many pontificating personalities on tv masquerading as factual reporters. The majority of the public can’t spot a reporter from a pundit, nor define the difference.

talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter: Yes, we agree on the blurring of media vs journalism. Most shows now are led by “hosts” of different stripes, but do they actually rely on journalists and trained reporters? I feel it is where we have been led down the false equivalency path. Too many talking heads.

talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter:
Except Mehdi is not an actual journalist. These channels have blurred the lines with these pundits who are lawyers, political consultants, politicians, broadcasters and “personalities”. 

Where are the journalists? The reporters? Actual members of the press? 

Expertise is taking a backseat.

talk.author: did:plc:og46rvum7lhi3mfyyy7odtir
talk.utter: I’m sorry, what about Mehdi isn’t a journalist? Every single facet of his career has been in journalism. He may *have* a strong personality, but if you actually listen to him, he can argue all sides of an issue - like a journalist. And he asks much deeper & more probing questions than most.

talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter: Not going after Mehdi specifically and he has been a good voice. I think he did better than most in presenting actual journalists and reported on his show. Respectfully I would add that arguing is not what true journalism is about, it’s investigation, research and presentation of facts.

talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter: Not going after Mehdi specifically and he has been a good voice. I think he did better than most in presenting actual journalists and reported on his show. Respectfully I would add that arguing is not what true journalism is about, it’s investigation, research and presentation of facts.

talk.author: did:plc:og46rvum7lhi3mfyyy7odtir
talk.utter: I agree with that. But I think Hasan can argue a point because he is well researched & brings his guests who try do “do the weave” back to the topic at hand.

talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter: So true. His skills at debating are exceptional, great point. He is brilliant and that is augmented by his research and vast knowledge. It was so disheartening MSNBC let his show go.

talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter: Not going after Mehdi specifically and he has been a good voice. I think he did better than most in presenting actual journalists and reported on his show. Respectfully I would add that arguing is not what true journalism is about, it’s investigation, research and presentation of facts.

talk.author: did:plc:7v3irvxqo5q7dpzblngyd5n5
talk.utter:
But *that* is not what that format is for. MtP et al are ABOUT direct confrontation, not investigative reporting. 

That's 60 Minutes.

talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter: For me, I would like to see push back from the press and in order to push back the anchor has to have research, investigation and facts behind that. Accuracy and courage are required, judicious confrontation,  not these screaming panels. Mehdi is courageous and well informed. MSNBC messed up.

talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter:
Except Mehdi is not an actual journalist. These channels have blurred the lines with these pundits who are lawyers, political consultants, politicians, broadcasters and “personalities”. 

Where are the journalists? The reporters? Actual members of the press? 

Expertise is taking a backseat.

talk.author: did:plc:7v3irvxqo5q7dpzblngyd5n5
talk.utter:
When was the last time an honest to god old school "classically trained" journalist hosted a Sunday morning show?

(Tapper maybe? I'd rather Mehdi do an interview than Tapper)

It's not necessarily the main qualification anyway, being a fearless interviewer doesn't require the same skills.

talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter: Yeah, not a fan of Tapper’s either. Not sure he is “classically trained”. MTP hasn’t been watchable for years now. I am hopeful we can all demand better from the press and our media by our viewing choices. Would love more real investigative reporting. What are you watching?

talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter: Yeah, not a fan of Tapper’s either. Not sure he is “classically trained”. MTP hasn’t been watchable for years now. I am hopeful we can all demand better from the press and our media by our viewing choices. Would love more real investigative reporting. What are you watching?

talk.author: did:plc:7v3irvxqo5q7dpzblngyd5n5
talk.utter:
due to me TV schedule they only things I regularly watch live are the MSNBC evening shows (and little of that since the election, for a mental health break) but I supplement that with highlighted content from Zetao and stuff like 60 Minutes that seem well reported

Interview shows are less appealing

talk.author: did:plc:6m265e37be35znfdhhex2ixd
talk.utter: Good idea to take a break from the media, I’ve done the same. I think it has helped me start to see things more objectively; the media has not been our friend for a long time and I’m sure I see much hope from our usual sites. We need to seek out and support sources that meet our standards.
